intro: Ceratocapnos turbinata, commonly known as the Turbinated Bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while its flowers range in color from white to pale blue. Ceratocapnos turbinata is often found in high-altitude meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal in botanical gardens.
